briefdescription.para: Maximum finite log-likelihood ratio value.
Minimum finite log-likelihood ratio value.
"Positive infinity" log-likelihood ratio.
TS 38.321, 6.1.3.1 - Buffer Status Report MAC CEs.
For FR1 FDD band with LTE-NR coexistence case.
For FR1 FDD band without LTE-NR coexistence case or for FR1 TDD band without LTE-NR coexistence case.
For FR2.
For FR1 TDD band with LTE-NR coexistence case.
Time advance offset - parameter $N_{TA,offset}$ in TS38.211 Section 4.3.3.

detaileddescription.para: This value must be selected from the parameter n-TimingAdvanceOffset (TS38.331 Section 6.3.2, Information Element ServingCellConfigCommon) if it is present. Otherwise, it is given by TS38.133 Section 7.1.2 depending on the duplex mode of the cell and the frequency range.
The values are given in units of $T_c$ (see TS38.211 Section 4.1).

briefdescription.para: CRC cyclic generator polynomials identifiers.
No CDM, i.e. CDM group of size 1.
Frequency-domain CDM group of size 2.
CDM group of size 4 (two frequency-domain locations and two time-domain locations).
CDM group of size 8 (two frequency-domain locations and four time-domain locations).
Code-Division Multiplexing (CDM) strategies for CSI-RS.
One RE occupied in even-numbered PRB.
One RE occupied in odd-numbered PRB.
One RE occupied in every PRB.
Three RE occupied in every PRB.
Strategies regarding Resource Element (RE) density in the frequency domain for CSI-RS signals.
NR operating bands in FR1 and FR2.

detaileddescription.para: This enumeration abstracts the NR operating bands for FR1 and FR2 described in TS 38.104, Table 5.2-1 and Table 5.2-2, respectively.

briefdescription.para: Labels for the BS Channel Bandwidth for FR1, described in TS38.104, Table 5.3.2-1.

detaileddescription.para: Labels for the Minimum Channel Bandwidth for FR1< >. This is not explicitly defined in the TS, but it is used by TS 38.213, Section 13 for the Coreset 0 configuration. As per TS 38.104, Table 5.3.5-1, there are three possible minimum BW: 5MHz, 10MHz, and 40MHz.

briefdescription.para: Maximum number of UEs supported by DU (implementation-defined).
Maximum number of cells supported by DU (implementation-defined).
Maximum number of cells supported by a single UE.
Paired FDD.
Unpaired TDD.
Supplementary DownLink (Unpaired).
Supplementary UpLink (Unpaired).
NR Duplex mode.
Frequency range 1, from 410 to 7125 MHz.
Frequency range 2, from 24250 to 52600 MHz.
Labels for the frequency ranges described in TS38.104 Table 5.1-1.
Logical Channel Identity used to associate one logical channel to the corresponding RLC bearer. Values (0..32)
LDPC Base graph types.
90-degree shifting Binary Phase Shift Keying (/2-BPSK) described in TS38.211 Section 5.1.1.
Binary Phase Shift Keying (BPSK) modulation described in TS38.211 Section 5.1.2.
Quadrature Phase Shift Keying (QPSK) modulation described in TS38.211 Section 5.1.3.
16-point Quadrature Amplitude Modulation (16-QAM) described in TS38.211 Section 5.1.4.
64-point Quadrature Amplitude Modulation (64-QAM) described in TS38.211 Section 5.1.5.
256-point Quadrature Amplitude Modulation (256-QAM) described in TS38.211 Section 5.1.6.
Modulation schemes as described in TS38.211 Section 5.1.

detaileddescription.para: Each modulation identifier is mapped to the corresponding modulation order.

briefdescription.para: Aggregation Level of PDCCH allocation.
CORESET identifier. This value is UE-specific, which means that a UE can have up to "maxNrofControlResourceSets" CORESETS configured.

simplesect.para: See TS 38.331, "maxNrofControlResourceSets".

briefdescription.para: Refer to "SS/PBCH block and CORESET multiplexing pattern", TS 38.213, Section 13.
Identifies MCS index table 1, TS38.214 Table 5.1.3.1-1.
Identifies MCS index table 2, TS38.214 Table 5.1.3.1-2.
Identifies MCS index table 3, TS38.214 Table 5.1.3.1-3.
Modulation and Code Scheme table identifiers for PDSCH.

detaileddescription.para: The identifiers are inspired by TS38.331 Section as 6.3.2 (see field mcs-Table in various Information Elements). For the actual tables and the selection procedure, see TS38.214 Section 5.1.3.1.

briefdescription.para: PRACH Restricted set configuration.

detaileddescription.para: PRACH $N_{CS}$ restricted set configuration. Used for interpreting TS38.211 Tables 6.3.3.1-5 and 6.3.3.1-6.

briefdescription.para: Implies neither group or sequence hopping is enabled.
Enables group hopping and disables sequence hopping.
Disables group hopping and enables sequence hopping.
Configuration of group and sequence hopping as described in TS38.331 PUCCH-ConfigCommon IE.
PUCCH Formats as described in TS 38.213 clause 9.2.
Identifies MCS index table 1, TS38.214 Table 5.1.3.1-1.
Identifies MCS index table 2, TS38.214 Table 5.1.3.1-2.
Identifies MCS index table 3, TS38.214 Table 5.1.3.1-3.
Identifies MCS index table 1 with transform precoding, TS38.214 Table 6.1.4.1-1.
Identifies MCS index table 2 with transform precoding, TS38.214 Table 6.1.4.1-2.
Modulation and Code Scheme table identifiers for PUSCH.

detaileddescription.para: The identifiers are inspired by TS38.331 Section as 6.3.2 (see field mcs-Table in various Information Elements). For the actual tables and the selection procedure, see TS38.214 Section 6.1.4.1.

simplesect.para: See TS 38.331 - RNTI-Value and TS 38.321, Table 7.1-1: RNTI Values. Values: (0..65535)

briefdescription.para: SIB retransmission periodicity in milliseconds as per TS38.331 Section 5.2.1.

simplesect.para: This is used for retransmission periodicity only; SIB1 periodicity is given as 160ms.

briefdescription.para: SSB periodicity in milliseconds as per TS38.331 Section 6.3.2 IE ssb-periodicityServingCell.
PSS EPRE to SSS EPRE for SSB, as per TS 38.213, Section 4.1.
Case A - 15 kHz SCS, FR1: index pattern $\{2, 8\} + 14\cdot n$.
Case B - 30 kHz SCS, FR1: index pattern $\{4, 8, 16, 20\} + 28\cdot n$.
Case C - 30 kHz SCS, FR1: index pattern $\{2, 8\} + 14\cdot n$.
Case D - 120 kHz SCS, FR2: index pattern $\{4, 8, 16, 20\} + 28\cdot n$.
Case E - 240 kHz SCS, FR2: index pattern $\{8, 12, 16, 20, 32, 36, 40, 44 \} + 56\cdot n$.
Invalid case.

Search Space identifier. This value is UE-specific, which means that a UE can have up to "maxNrofSearchSpaces=40" Search Spaces configured. The ID space is used across BWPs of a serving cell.

detaileddescription.para:
BWP-Id used to identify a BWP from the perspective of a UE.
See TS 38.331, "BWP-Id" and "maxNrofBWPs".

PDSCH Mapping Type. TypeA can start only at symbol 2 or 3 within a slot.
see TS 38.214, clause 5.3.

briefdescription.para: Position of first DM-RS for Downlink (see TS 38.211, clause 7.4.1.1.1) and Uplink (see TS 38.211, clause 6.4.1.1.3).

detaileddescription.para:
Type of DMRS to be used in DL and UL.

briefdescription.para: Position for additional DM-RS in DL (see TS 38.211, Tables 7.4.1.1.2-3 and 7.4.1.1.2-4).

simplesect.para: See TS 38.331, DMRS-DownlinkConfig and DMRS-UplinkConfig.

simplesect.para: See TS 38.214, DMRS-DownlinkConfig.

Maximum number of PDUs per slot. This value is implementation-defined.
It should match FAPI MaxULPDUsPerSlot.

Defines the SSB bandwidth in Resource Blocks (RBs)

Defines the SSB bandwidth in Resource Elements.
Defines the maximum number of ports for any channel transmission.
UCI placeholder bit.

detaileddescription.para: A placeholder for setting a bit to 1 in the scrambler. It is denoted as "\c x" in TS38.212 Section 5.3.3 and in TS38.211 Section 6.3.1.1.

briefdescription.para: UCI placeholder bit.

detaileddescription.para: A placeholder for repeating the previous bit in the scrambler. It is denoted as "\c y" in TS38.212 Section 5.3.3 and in TS38.211 Section 6.3.1.1.

briefdescription.para: Maximum number of DM-RS symbols for one layer.

detaileddescription.para: At most half of the total number of subcarriers (i.e., MAX_RB * NRE / 2) is assigned a DM-RS symbol. Moreover, the number of OFDM symbols carrying DM-RS in a slot is at most $4 \times 2$, being 4 the maximum number of positions $\bar{l}$ and 2 the maximum number of indices $l'$, as per TS38.211 Section 6.4.1.1.

briefdescription.para: Maximum segment length.

detaileddescription.para: This is given by the maximum lifting size (i.e., 384) times the maximum number of information bits in base graph BG1 (i.e., 22), as per TS38.212 Section 5.2.2.

briefdescription.para: Maximum number of segments per transport block.
Defines the maximum number of ports DMRS can be mapped to.
Maximum number of channels per stream in a radio baseband unit.
Maximum number of streams that a radio baseband unit can support.
Total maximum number of ports that a radio baseband unit can support.
Returns the maximum number of OFDM symbols per slot.
The number of OFDM symbols per slot is constant for all numerologies.

detaileddescription.para:
Maximum value of Logical Channel ID.
See TS 38.331, maxLC-ID.

briefdescription.para: Maximum number of bits per symbol.

detaileddescription.para:

briefdescription.para: Maximum number of layers (implementation-defined)

detaileddescription.para: SSB constants. FR1 = 410 MHz 7125 MHz and ARFCN corresponding to 7.125GHz is 875000.

briefdescription.para: The cutoff frequency for case A, B and C paired is 3GHz, corresponding to 600000 ARFCN (TS 38.213, Section 4.1).
The cutoff frequency for case C unpaired is 1.88GHz, corresponding to 376000 ARFCN (TS 38.213, Section 4.1).

detaileddescription.para: SIB1 constants. SIB1 periodicity, see TS 38.331, Section 5.2.1.
[Implementation defined] Max numbers of beams, to be used for SIB1 scheduler. NOTE: This is temporary, and valid only for FR1.

briefdescription.para: Maximum grants per slot. Implementation-specific.
Maximum Logical channels per TB. Implementation-specific.

detaileddescription.para: Maximum SSB opportunity per slot. This can be derived from the candidate ODFM symbols indices within the ranges 0-13, 14-27, 28-41, 42-55, etc.. from TS 38.213, Section 4.1.

briefdescription.para: [Implementation defined] This corresponds to "Number of search space sets per slot" in Table 13-11, TS 38.213.
[Implementation defined] This corresponds to maximum number of RARs that can be scheduled per slot.

detaileddescription.para: Maximum number of PRACH occasions within a slot as per TS38.211, Tables 6.3.3.2-[2-4] and maximum msg1-FDM of 8 according to TS 38.331.

briefdescription.para: Maximum number of codewords per PDSCH grant. Implementation-specific.
Defines two times Pi.
Number of subcarriers within a SSB block, as per TS 38.211, Section 7.4.3.1.

Min ARFCN value for range of frequencies above 24.25GHz, as per Table 5.4.2.1-1, TS 38.104.
Offet $F_{REF-Offs}$ expressed in Hz, for 3GHz-24.25GHz freq. range, as per Table 5.4.2.1-1, TS 38.104.
Freq. step in Hz, corresponding to $N$ for 0GHz-3GHz freq. range, as per Table 5.4.3.1-1, TS 38.104.
Freq. step in Hz, corresponding to $M$ for 0GHz-3GHz freq. range, as per Table 5.4.3.1-1, TS 38.104.
Freq. step in Hz, corresponding to $M$ for 3GHz-24.25GHz freq. range, as per Table 5.4.3.1-1, TS 38.104.
Upper-bound for $N$ within 0GHz-3GHz freq. range, as per Table 5.4.3.1-1, TS 38.104.
Upper-bound for $N$ within 3GHz-24.25GHz freq. range, as per Table 5.4.3.1-1, TS 38.104.

Maximum length of a codeword.
Maximum length of a message.
Half of the maximum codebook size.

memberdef.argsstring: (const bounded_bitset< N, reversed > &other, size_t fold_length, size_t slice_offset, size_t slice_length) noexcept
memberdef.name: fold_and_accumulate

briefdescription.para: Divides a bitset of size "S" into "M" smaller bitsets, where each bitset has length "L=S/M". A bitwise-or operation is performed across bitsets. At the end, a slice with an offset "O" and length "K" is taken from the bitset of length "L" that resulted from the bitwise-or operation. This operation is equivalent to reshaping an array of bits of size "S" into a matrix of dimensions "(M, L)" and applying an "or" operation across all bits of each column. The resulting array of "L" bits, is then sliced with an offset "O" and length "K". The operation asserts if "S % L != 0". E.g. Consider the bitset 1000 0100 0000 1001 (S=16), L=4, O=1, K=2. This function performs the following steps:

listitem.para: Break the bitset into M=S/L=4 parts: {1000, 0100, 0000, 1001}.
Slice the bitset obtained in 2. with offset O=1 and slice length K=2: 10.

parameterdescription.para: maximum bitset size for returned bitset.
original bitset of length "S".
length of each folded bitset "L".
offset from where to slice each fold "O".
length of the slice taken from each fold "K".

simplesect.para: bitset of size slice_length with the or-accumulated folds.

memberdef.argsstring: (const bounded_bitset< N, reversed > &other, size_t fold_length) noexcept
memberdef.name: fold_and_accumulate

briefdescription.para: Performs the fold and accumulate operation, but without slicing at the end.

parameterdescription.para: maximum bitset size for returned bitset.
internal bit order representation of returned bitset.
original bitset from where folds are generated.
length of each fold bitset.

simplesect.para: bitset of size fold_length with the accumulated folds.

briefdescription.para: Get the CORESET configuration for Type0-PDCCH CSS.

SS/PBCH block subcarrier spacing.
PDCCH subcarrier spacing.
Parameter controlResourceSetZero as per TS38.331 PDCCH-ConfigSIB1.
Offset between the CRB and the beginning of the SS/PBCH block.

simplesect.para: A valid CORESET description if config is valid. Otherwise, PDCCH_TYPE0_CSS_CORESET_RESERVED.

briefdescription.para: Gets a PRACH configuration.

detaileddescription.para:
Arguments are considered valid if:
They are consistent with the TS38.211 Tables 6.3.3.2-2, 6.3.3.2-3 and 6.3.3.2-4, and
the combination is implemented.
Currently, only long preamble formats for FR1 in FDD mode are implemented.

parameterdescription.para: Frequency range (see here for more information).
Duplex mode (see here for more information).
PRACH configuration index with range {0, ..., 255}.

simplesect.para: A valid PRACH configuration if the provided arguments are valid. Otherwise, PRACH_CONFIG_RESERVED.

briefdescription.para: Calculates the number of cyclic shifts $N_{CS}$ used in the sequence generation as per TS38.211 Section 6.3.3.1.

detaileddescription.para:
The number of cyclic shifts $N_{CS}$ is extracted from:
TS38.211 Table 6.3.3.1-5 for preambles 0, 1 and 2
TS38.211 Table 6.3.3.1-6 for preamble 3, and
TS38.211 Table 6.3.3.1-7 for the remaining preambles.

parameterdescription.para: PRACH subcarrier spacing (parameter $\Delta f^{RA}$ as defined in TS38.211 Section 6.3.3.1).
Restricted set (see restrictedSetConfig in TS38.331 Section 6.3.2, Information Element RACH-ConfigCommon).
Zero correlation zone (see zeroCorrelationZoneConfig in TS38.331 Section 6.3.2, Information Element RACH-ConfigGeneric).

simplesect.para: The number of cyclic shifts if the input parameters are valid. Otherwise, PRACH_CYCLIC_SHIFTS_RESERVED.

detaileddescription.para: Reserved target code rates and spectral efficiencies are indicated with zero.

parameterdescription.para: MCS table.
MCS index.
Set to true if higher layer parameter tp-pi2BPSK is enabled. See TS38.331 Section 6.3.2 Information Element PUSCH-Config for more information.

simplesect.para: Modulation and Coding Scheme parameters.

briefdescription.para: Calculates the resource indication value $RIV$ as per TS38.214 Section 5.1.2.2.2 for Downlink and Section 6.1.2.2 for Uplink.

detaileddescription.para: if $(L_{RB} - 1) \leq \left \lfloor N_{BWP}^{size}/2 \right \rfloor$, then $RIV = N_{BWP}^{size}(L_{RBs}-1)+RB_{start}$ Otherwise, $RIV = N_{BWP}^{size}(N_{BWP}^{size}-L_{RBs}+1)+(N_{BWP}^{size}-1-RB_{start})$.

briefdescription.para: Calculates the PRBs from $RIV$ as per TS 38.214 Section 5.1.2.2.2 for Downlink and Section 6.1.2.2 for Uplink.
Calculates the resource indication value $RIV$ for special cases as per TS38.214 Section 5.1.2.2.2 for Downlink and Section 6.1.2.2 for Uplink.

detaileddescription.para: if $(L'_{RB} - 1) \leq \left \lfloor N_{BWP}^{initial}/2 \right \rfloor$, then $RIV = N_{BWP}^{initial}(L'_{RBs}-1)+RB'_{start}$ Otherwise, $RIV = N_{BWP}^{initial}(N_{BWP}^{initial}-L'_{RBs}+1)+(N_{BWP}^{initial}-1-RB'_{start})$. Where $L'_{RB}=L_{RB}/K$, $RB'_{start}=RB_{start}/K$. if $N_{BWP}^{active}>N_{BWP}^{initial}$ then $K$ is the maximum value from set {1,2,4,8} which satisfies $K \leq \left \lfloor N_{BWP}^{active}/ N_{BWP}^{initial}\right \rfloor$; otherwise $K=1$.

detaileddescription.para: Convert a slot point to another numerology. This function applies a "floor" operation when the new numerology is lower than the old one. E.g. Given two numerologies mu1 and mu2, where m1 < m2, this conversion function "f" will always ensure that, for a slot t1 with m1 numerology, the condition "f(f(t1, mu2), m1) <= t1" is satisfied.

briefdescription.para: Calculates the position of the first SS/PBCH block subcarrier relative to Point A.

detaileddescription.para:
The result is expressed in units of subcarriers of SS/PBCH block SCS ssb_scs assuming that:
the lowest subcarrier of the resource grid overlaps with Point A, and
the resource grid SCS matches the SS/PBCH block SCS.

In other words, it is not possible to determine an SS/PBCH block position in the grid if the SS/PBCH block subcarrier offset does not match the position of the resource grid subcarriers. Because of this, the parameters must result in an integer subcarrier index of the SS/PBCH block SCS.

Assertions are triggered if:
the provided SS/PBCH SCS and frequency range combination is invalid, or
the result would point to a non-integer subcarrier index.

parameterdescription.para: Frequency range.
SS/PBCH block subcarrier spacing.
Higher layer parameter subCarrierSpacingCommon as per TS38.331 MIB.
Offset to Point A (see here for more information).
Subcarrier offset (see here for more information).

simplesect.para: The index of the lowest subcarrier of the SS/PBCH block.

parameterdescription.para: SSB Subcarrier Spacing.
DL ARFCN.

simplesect.para: L_max value.

briefdescription.para: Create L2 scheduler object.
Creates an instance of a SDAP entity interface.

detaileddescription.para: Factories are at a low level point of abstraction, as such, they are the "only" (best effort) objects that depend on concrete class implementations instead of interfaces, intrinsically giving them tight coupling to the objects being created. Keeping this coupling in a single file, is the best, as the rest of the code can be kept decoupled.

briefdescription.para: Creates an instance of a SDAP interface.

detaileddescription.para: Factories are at a low level point of abstraction, as such, they are the "only" (best effort) objects that depend on concrete class implementations instead of interfaces, intrinsically giving them tight coupling to the objects being created. Keeping this coupling in a single file, is the best, as the rest of the code can be kept decoupled.

briefdescription.para: This function forbids the compiler from optimizing away expressions without side-effects.

Command to terminate application with an error message, ensuring first that the log is flushed. Attribute noinline is used to signal to the compiler that this path should rarely occur and therefore doesn't need to get optimized.

briefdescription.para: Helper function to create an allocation mask from a PRB mask and a RE mask.

detaileddescription.para: Creates an allocation where PRB are selected from prb_mask and the RE within the PRB are selected using prb_mask_re.

The resultant mask is relative to to the lowest subcarrier of the lowest selected PRB. In other words, the first element of the resultant mask coincides with the lowest subcarrier of the first selected PRB in prb_mask.

briefdescription.para: Helper function to generate DMRS sequences.

detaileddescription.para: This function generates DMRS sequences based on a pseudo-random sequence generation. It generates nof_dmrs_per_rb for every active resource block given in rb_mask and skips the nof_dmrs_per_rb for every inactive resource block.

parameterdescription.para: Provides the destination storage for the generated sequence.
Provides the pseudo-random generator to use.
Provides the sequence amplitude.
Indicates the RB index for reference.
Indicates the number of DMRS to generate per active RB.
Indicates the active resource blocks.

simplesect.para: It assumes that the pseudo-random generator is initialized.
The sequence size must be consistent with the number of active RBs and the number of DMRS per RB.

detaileddescription.para: Convert between string and BCD-coded MCC. Digits are represented by 4-bit nibbles. Unused nibbles are filled with 0xf. MCC 001 results in 0xf001
Convert between array of bytes and BCD-coded MCC. Digits are represented by 4-bit nibbles. Unused nibbles are filled with 0xf. MCC 001 results in 0xf001
Convert between string and BCD-coded MNC. Digits are represented by 4-bit nibbles. Unused nibbles are filled with 0xf. MNC 001 results in 0xf001 MNC 01 results in 0xff01
Convert between array of bytes and BCD-coded MNC. Digits are represented by 4-bit nibbles. Unused nibbles are filled with 0xf. MNC 001 results in 0xf001 MNC 01 results in 0xff01

Convert PLMN to BCD-coded MCC and MNC. Digits are represented by 4-bit nibbles. Unused nibbles are filled with 0xf. MNC 001 represented as 0xf001 MNC 01 represented as 0xff01 PLMN encoded as per TS 38.413 sec 9.3.3.5

Convert BCD-coded MCC and MNC to PLMN. Digits are represented by 4-bit nibbles. Unused nibbles are filled with 0xf. MNC 001 represented as 0xf001 MNC 01 represented as 0xff01 PLMN encoded as per TS 38.413 sec 9.3.3.5

Derives Carrier CRB limits from scs-SpecificCarrier.

Get MSG3 Delay.
pusch_td_res_alloc

pusch_scs
SCS used by initial UL BWP.
Msg3 delay in number of slots.

Get RA-RNTI based on PRACH parameters.

briefdescription.para: Derive SSB Subcarrier Spacing from SSB pattern case.
Schedule grant for SSB.

detaileddescription.para: The functions schedules the SSB according to a given periodicity, depending on the frequency and SSB case

parameterdescription.para: Slot allocator object with SSB grants and DL PRBs.
Slot point carrying information about current slot.
Reference to scheduler cell configuration.

simplesect.para: This function only works for FR1, or L_max = 4 or 8.

briefdescription.para: Helper function to check whether a SearchSpace PDCCH is monitored by the UE for a given slot.

parameterdescription.para: Slot in which the SearchSpace is being monitored.
SearchSpace configuration.

simplesect.para: true if the SearchSpace is being monitored. False, otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Convert PRB within a BWP into a Common RB, which use pointA as reference point. The CRB and PRB are assumed to have the same numerology of the provided BWP configuration. The existence of a CORESET#0 may also affect the rules for CRB<->PRB conversion.

parameterdescription.para: BWP configuration of the respective PRB.
PRB to be converted to CRB.

simplesect.para: Calculated CRB.

detaileddescription.para:
Convert PRBs within a BWP into Common RBs, which use pointA as reference point. CRBs and PRBs are assumed to have the same numerology of the provided BWP configuration.
bwp_cfg
BWP configuration of the respective PRB interval.
prbs
PRBs to be converted to CRBs.
Calculated CRB interval.

briefdescription.para: Convert CRB within a BWP into a PRB. The CRB and PRB are assumed to use the same numerology as reference.

parameterdescription.para: BWP configuration of the respective CRB.
CRB to be converted to PRB.

simplesect.para: Calculated PRB.

detaileddescription.para: Convert CRBs to PRBs within a BWP. CRBs and PRBs are assumed to have the same numerology of the provided BWP configuration.

Retrieves the time resource allocation table for PUSCH.
See TS 38.214, Section 6.1.2.1.1 - Determination of the resource allocation table to be used for PUSCH.

Computes the lowest RB used by the CORESET.

Calculates number of CCEs in CORESET.
Calculates the number of RE used for DMRS per RB in PDSCH and PUSCH transmissions.

detaileddescription.para:
Helper factory of a default DM-RS Information object for DCI f1_0 or for when higher layer configuration parameters are not yet available. TODO: generalize to other cases (e.g. mapping type B).
See TS 38.214, 5.1.6.2 - DM-RS reception procedure.

briefdescription.para: Get Type0-PDCCH CSS occasions for multiplexing pattern 1 as per TS38.213 Section 13.

detaileddescription.para: The Type0-PDCCH CSS occasions are retrieved from TS38.213 Table 13-11 for FR1 and Table 13-12 for FR2.
An assertion is triggered if config is not valid.

parameterdescription.para: Provides the necessary parameters to calculate the occasions.

simplesect.para: A valid Type0-PDCCH CSS occasion for multiplexing pattern 1.

briefdescription.para: Determines the default PDSCH time-domain resource allocation A.

detaileddescription.para: The time domain allocation configuration is described in TS38.214 Table 5.1.2.1.1-2 for normal cyclic prefix and TS38.214 Table 5.1.2.1.1-3 for extended cyclic prefix.

parameterdescription.para: Cyclic prefix.
Row index.
DM-RS for mapping Type A position.

simplesect.para: A valid PDSCH time-domain allocation configuration is the provided parameters are valid. Otherwise, PDSCH_DEFAULT_TIME_ALLOCATION_RESERVED.

briefdescription.para: Determines the table of default PDSCH time-domain resource allocation A.

parameterdescription.para: Cyclic prefix.
DM-RS for mapping Type A position.

simplesect.para: A list of valid PDSCH time-domain allocation configurations to choose from.

briefdescription.para: Calculates the DMRS for PDSCH symbol mask for single duration.

detaileddescription.para: It is implemented as per TS38.211 Table 5.1.2.1.1-2.
Any configuration that is not covered in the table triggers an assertion.

briefdescription.para: Computes the required number of PRBs necessary to transmit a given payload size.

detaileddescription.para: This function implements the inverse procedure of the TBS calculation procedure (as per TS38.214 Section 5.1.3.2) to derive the number of PRBs from a given payload in bytes.

simplesect.para: This function only works for payload size <= 478 bytes (3824 bits).

If the TBS that corresponds to input payload exceeds the maximum 478 bytes, the function is working outside its range. In that case, the function returns the max num. of PRBs such that the corresponding TBS won't exceed the max value of 478 bytes. Note that this value would not be enough to fit the payload. It is up to the caller to handle this case.

parameterdescription.para: is a struct with the PDSCH configuration to compute the num. of PRBs.

simplesect.para: Returns a struct with the number of PRBs and the corresponding TBS. If the payload_size is greater than 478 bytes (3824 bits), it returns the number of PRBs and TBS corresponding to maximum allowed payload size of 478 bytes.

briefdescription.para: Finds the next contiguous range of PRBs whose respective bit in provided RB bitmap is set to zero.

parameterdescription.para: Bitmap of RBs, where 1's represent used RBs and 0's empty RBs.
Minimum RB index from where the search is initiated.
Maximum RB index (excluding) that limits the range of RBs where the search is carried out.

simplesect.para: An interval of contiguous RBs where the respective bits are set to zero. If no interval was found, an empty interval is returned.

briefdescription.para: Finds a range of contiguous RBs, whose value in the provided RB bitmap is set to zero. The returned range length should be at most "nof_rbs" RBs. If no range with length "nof_rbs" is found, the longest valid range of RBs set to zero in "used_rb_bitmap" is returned.

parameterdescription.para: Bitmap of RBs, where 1's represent used RBs and 0's empty RBs.
Maximum range of RBs
Minimum RB index from where the search is initiated.

simplesect.para: An interval of RBs with maximum length equal to "nof_rbs".

briefdescription.para: Converts TB scaling field into Scaling Factor S (see Table 5.1.3.2-2, TS 38.214).

parameterdescription.para: is the TB scaling field, possible values are {0,1,2}.

simplesect.para: Scaling factor S corresponding to scaling.

briefdescription.para: Get smallest TBS in bits (from Table 5.1.3.2-1, TS 38.214) greater than or equal to a given value.

parameterdescription.para: is the quantized intermediate num. of information bits, as per Section 5.1.3.2, TS 38.214.

simplesect.para: nof_info_prime must not be greater than 3824 bits.
The smallest TBS from Table 5.1.3.2-1, TS 38.214 that is greater than or equal to nof_info_prime.

briefdescription.para: Calculates the TBS for a given PDSCH transmission.

detaileddescription.para: Implemented as per TS38.214 Section 5.1.3.2.

briefdescription.para: Logical Channel Group and UL Buffer Size format definition and levels according to 3GPP TS 38.321 version 15.3.0.

detaileddescription.para: Notice that we are not using any implementation specific header files. We are decoupled.

In this file, we implement several algorithms used to add/mod/release asn.1 objects in lists based on their ids. This operations are commonly used during the application of Diffs/Deltas when the UE has to be reconfigured.
This factory header file depends on the PDCP entity interfaces (see above include list). It is kept separate as clients of the PDCP entity interfaces dont need to call factory methods.
This header is currently used only by the MAC to compute extra SSB parameters (needed for scheduling) from those provided by DU.
This factory header file depends on the SDAP entity interfaces (see above include list). It is kept separate as clients of the SDAP entity interfaces dont need to call factory methods.
This factory header file depends on the SDAP interfaces (see above include list). It is kept separate as clients of the SDAP interfaces dont need to call factory methods.
This class implementation is decoupled from other concrete class implementations as it only depend on public interfaces.
